summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from January 2020 regarding preparation for an interview with the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) about the FBI's Human Trafficking program. The emails discuss potential case examples to highlight, including the high-profile Epstein and NXIVM cases, as well as other recent trafficking investigations.

persons.name: I. M. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears to be the primary sender/forwarder of the email chain, involved in coordinating a meeting to prepare the ADIC for an interview on human trafficking.

persons.name: G. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Primary recipient of the forwarded email, being asked about availability for an informal meeting with the ADIC.

persons.name: Hubert Dupigny
persons.context: Mentioned as a convicted sex trafficker in a case spun off from the 'Hard Knock HT' investigation, presented as an example of the FBI's work.

events.title: ADIC Interview Prep Meeting
events.description: An informal meeting is scheduled to prepare the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) for an interview on human trafficking with a radio station.

events.title: Radio Interview on Human Trafficking
events.description: The ADIC is scheduled to give a longer-form interview for a new monthly podcast with a radio station, with the first topic being human trafficking.

keyFacts: The FBI's Human Trafficking program was preparing media communications in January 2020, specifically an interview with the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC).
The email explicitly lists 'the high profile cases like Epstein and NXIVM' as examples the ADIC could discuss in the interview, indicating these were considered representative of the FBI's work.
Other case examples provided include the conviction of Hubert Dupigny for sex trafficking and arrests in the Bronx and Brooklyn related to gang-associated trafficking.
The communication shows internal FBI coordination to shape public messaging on human trafficking, seeking recent case examples and trends from the prior four months.
